DataElement.preferredName: Timeline Followback Method Illicit Substance Opioid Methadone Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the participant had used opioid analgesics (including methadone), and misused prescription pain medications, such as oxycodone (OxyContin, Percocet), hydrocodone (Vicodin), morphine, Dilaudid, fentanyl, and buprenorphine (Suboxone, Subutex) as part of the Timeline Followback Method assessment, a calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Timeline Followback Method Illicit Substance Opioid Methadone Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a Timeline Followback Method assessment (a calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use) of illicit substance use (drugs or alcoholic beverages deemed harmful and usually subject to legal restriction) of opioids (a class of synthetic chemicals/drugs similar to opiates-opium derivatives-with analgesic properties) including methadone (a synthetic opioid with analgesic activity; methadone mimics the actions of endogenous peptides at CNS opioid receptors).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

Concepts.definition: A calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

Property.preferredDefinition: Something (as drugs or alcoholic beverages) deemed harmful and usually subject to legal restriction.:A class of synthetic chemicals/drugs similar to opiates (opium derivatives) with analgesic properties.  Due to binding to opiate receptors, opioids mimic opiate activity on neurons, various cells (i.e. lymphocytes), pain suppression and other neurobehavioral activity. (NCI):A synthetic opioid with analgesic activity. Methadone mimics the actions of endogenous peptides at CNS opioid receptors, primarily on the mu-receptor and has actions similar to those of morphine and morphine-like agents. The characteristic morphine-like effects include analgesia, euphoria, sedation, respiratory depression, miosis, bradycardia and physical dependence. However, the detoxification symptoms between morphine-like agents and methadone differ in that the onset of methadone's withdrawal symptoms is slower, the course is more prolonged and the symptoms are less severe.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Something (as drugs or alcoholic beverages) deemed harmful and usually subject to legal restriction.

A class of synthetic chemicals/drugs similar to opiates (opium derivatives) with analgesic properties.  Due to binding to opiate receptors, opioids mimic opiate activity on neurons, various cells (i.e. lymphocytes), pain suppression and other neurobehavioral activity. (NCI)

A synthetic opioid with analgesic activity. Methadone mimics the actions of endogenous peptides at CNS opioid receptors, primarily on the mu-receptor and has actions similar to those of morphine and morphine-like agents. The characteristic morphine-like effects include analgesia, euphoria, sedation, respiratory depression, miosis, bradycardia and physical dependence. However, the detoxification symptoms between morphine-like agents and methadone differ in that the onset of methadone's withdrawal symptoms is slower, the course is more prolonged and the symptoms are less severe.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk
